content: ISTM like this occupies a similar niche to the matches! macro in that it's common, useful (much nicer than directly invoking #[cfg()]), but often not worth pulling in as a separate dependency for simple cases. I think libcore would also be able to use it internally in some places â€” is there any reason not to do this?
This was discussed a while ago and I think the conclusion was that it isn't clear if cfg_if! is even a good interface to offer for cfgs
It's a little verbose but it's a lot cleaner than the current alternative. What are the other options?
